00029 /// \brief
00030 /// The FdoNullCondition class derives from FdoSearchCondition and can be used to test
00031 /// if the value of a specified data property is null.
00032 class FdoNullCondition : public FdoSearchCondition
00033 {
00034 protected:
00035 /// \cond DOXYGEN-IGNORE
00036     /// Constructs a default instance of an FdoNullCondition.
00037     FdoNullCondition();
00038 
00039     /// Constructs an instance of an FdoNullCondition using the specified arguments.
00040     FdoNullCondition(GisString* propertyName);
00041 
00042     /// Constructs an instance of an FdoNullCondition using the specified arguments.
00043     FdoNullCondition(FdoIdentifier* propertyName);
00044 
00045     virtual ~FdoNullCondition();
00046 
00047     virtual void Dispose();
00048 /// \endcond
00049 
00050 public:
00051     /// \brief
00052     /// Constructs a default instance of an FdoNullCondition.
00053     /// 
00054     /// \return
00055     /// Returns an FdoNullCondition
00056     /// 
00057     FDO_API static FdoNullCondition* Create();
00058 
00059     /// \brief
00060     /// Constructs an instance of an FdoNullCondition using the specified arguments.
00061     /// 
00062     /// \param propertyName 
00063     /// Input name
00064     /// 
00065     /// \return
00066     /// Returns an FdoNullCondition
00067     /// 
00068     FDO_API static FdoNullCondition* Create(GisString* propertyName);
00069 
00070     /// \brief
00071     /// Constructs an instance of an FdoNullCondition using the specified arguments.
00072     /// 
00073     /// \param propertyName 
00074     /// Input name
00075     /// 
00076     /// \return
00077     /// Returns an FdoNullCondition
00078     /// 
00079     FDO_API static FdoNullCondition* Create(FdoIdentifier* propertyName);
00080 
00081     /// \brief
00082     /// Gets the name of the data property.
00083     /// 
00084     /// \return
00085     /// Returns FdoIdentifier
00086     /// 
00087     FDO_API FdoIdentifier* GetPropertyName();
00088 
00089     /// \brief
00090     ///  Sets the name of the data property.
00091     /// 
00092     /// \param value 
00093     /// Input name
00094     /// 
00095     /// \return
00096     /// Returns nothing
00097     /// 
00098     FDO_API void SetPropertyName(FdoIdentifier* value);
00099 
00100     /// \brief
00101     /// Overrides FdoFilter.Process to pass the FdoNullCondition to the
00102     /// appropriate filter processor operation.
00103     /// 
00104     /// \param p

00106     /// 
00107     /// \return

00109     ///

00111 
00112 /// \cond DOXYGEN-IGNORE
00113     /// \brief
00114     /// This is an internal method. It returns the well defined text representation of the filter. 
00115     ///

00118     /// 
00119     /// \return

00121     ///
